revised_title: On the Disappearance of Sound in General Duane's Soundless Zones
tldr: Dr. John Tyndall investigates the phenomenon of soundless zones around fog-whistles, proposing that the disappearance of sound is due to interference between direct and reflected waves. He provides experimental evidence using a sensitive flame and a sounding reed, suggesting that the position of the zone of silence depends on the height of the signal, the observer, and the pitch of the whistle's note.
